workflow.name: Generate your GitLab year-in-review wrapped report automatically
workflow.description:
# GitLab Wrapped Generator

  ‚ú® **Automatically generate your personalized GitLab Wrapped**, a stunning year-in-review of your contributions, activity, and stats.

  Powered by [gitlab-wrapped](https://gitlab.com/michaelangelorivera/gitlab-wrapped) by [@michaelangelorivera](https://gitlab.com/michaelangelorivera).


  ## üöÄ How it works

 1. **Forks** the gitlab-wrapped project (or finds your existing fork)
  2. **Configures** CI/CD environment variables
  3. **Triggers** the GitLab pipeline
  4. **Monitors** until completion (polls every 2 minutes)

  üéâ **Your wrapped will be available at:**
  `https://YOUR-USERNAME.gitlab.io/gitlab-wrapped`

  ---

  ## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup

  1. **Create a GitLab PAT** with these scopes:
     - `api`
     - `read_repository`
     - `write_repository`

  2. **Fill out the form:**
     - Your GitLab username
     - Your PAT token
     - GitLab instance URL *(defaults to gitlab.com)*
     - Year *(defaults to 2025)*

  3. **Submit & relax!** ‚òï
     The workflow handles everything automatically.

  ---


  üí° Works with **GitLab.com** and **self-hosted instances**

  üìÖ Generate wrapped reports for **any past year**

parameters.formDescription: Generate your personalized GitLab Wrapped for 2024

nodes.name: No Operation, to not leak private Projects

parameters.content:
### How it works
This workflow generates your personalized GitLab Wrapped, a year-in-review of your GitLab contributions.

Powered by https://gitlab.com/michaelangelorivera/gitlab-wrapped by https://gitlab.com/michaelangelorivera

When you submit the form, the workflow:
1. Checks that the PAT does NOT belong to the username you entered. If they DO match, the workflow stops to prevent unauthorized access to private projects.
2. Forks (or finds your existing fork of) the gitlab-wrapped project
3. Configures CI/CD variables with your credentials and settings
4. Triggers the GitLab pipeline to generate your wrapped report
5. Monitors the pipeline until completion

### Setup steps
1. **Create a GitLab PAT** with `api`, `read_repository`, and `write_repository` scopes
2. Fill in the form with:
   - Your GitLab username
   - Your PAT token
   - GitLab instance URL (default: https://gitlab.com)
   - Year for your wrapped report

**üéâ Your wrapped will be available at:**
**`https://YOUR-USERNAME.gitlab.io/gitlab-wrapped`**

Replace `YOUR-USERNAME` with your GitLab username.

## üìã Form Input
Collects user credentials and preferences to generate the wrapped report.

## üîê Security Validation
Ensures the PAT token does not belong to the specified user to prevent unauthorized access to private projects.

## üç¥ Fork Setup
Creates or finds your fork of the gitlab-wrapped project to run the generation pipeline.

## ‚öôÔ∏è CI/CD Configuration
Configures environment variables in your fork to pass settings to the pipeline.

## üöÄ Pipeline Execution
Triggers the wrapped generation pipeline and monitors it until completion (polls every 2 minutes).

main.node: No Operation, to not leak private Projects

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
